text.#text:
There is established the Guidelines Review
				Board (hereafter in this part referred to as the

The Board shall, in accordance with the
				procedures described in part 3, review the voluntary voting system guidelines
				under such part.

The Board shall be
				composed of 82 members appointed as follows:

One State or local
				election official from each State, to be selected by the chief State election
				official of the State, who shall take into account the needs of both State and
				local election officials in making the selection.

2 members
				appointed by the National Conference of State Legislatures.

2 members
				appointed by the National Association of Secretaries of State.

2 members
				appointed by the National Association of State Election Directors.

2 members
				appointed by the National Association of County Recorders, Election
				Administrators, and Clerks.

2 members
				appointed by the Election Center.

2 members
				appointed by the International Association of County Recorders, Election
				Officials, and Treasurers.

The

The Board

The Board may use

header.#text:
Procedures for
			 adoption and modification of voluntary voting system guidelines

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a
			 study of the procedures used to adopt and modify the voluntary voting system
			 guidelines applicable to the administration of elections for Federal office,
			 and shall develop recommendations on methods to improve such procedures, taking
			 into account the needs of persons affected by such guidelines, including State
			 and local election officials, voters with disabilities, absent military and
			 overseas voters, and the manufacturers of voting systems.

, and shall include in the report the recommendations developed
			 under such paragraph.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

header.#text:
Procedures for
			 voting system testing and certification

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a study of the procedures for the
			 testing, certification, decertification, and recertification of voting system
			 hardware and software used in elections for Federal office, and shall develop a
			 recommendation on the entity that is best suited to oversee and carry out such
			 procedures, taking into consideration the needs of persons affected by such
			 procedures, including State and local election officials, voters with
			 disabilities, absent military and overseas voters, and the manufacturers of
			 voting systems.

, and shall
			 include in the report the recommendation developed under such paragraph.
